> If you want to 'unroll' the ARC into a file-per-URL, choosing
> practical=
 filenames for every URL can be tricky, and links
> between files will only=
 inconsistently work unless you do
> fairly intrusive rewriting of the orig=
inal content where necessary.
> 
> We can't yet recommend any good tool for=
 doing this.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA


Thank you very much for the replies. 

In=
 this case, i think if I wish to view each harvested data, I shall
write a =
program first use arcreader command to extract all 
offset numbers and file=
 names (from url) , and loop the "arcreader
=96-offset=3D =85" command to e=
xtract each data in ARC using the
offset and make a copy (e.g. =85=85 >  tm=
p.pdf) using the file name.

I would like to know after Heritrix harvested =
the web content, how 
they are made available for public access using Wayba=
ck machine? 
What is the standard way? Extract data form ARC one by one per=
 user 
request at Wayback machine and cache it? Or unpack the whole ARC to =

file directories for users access? Or other way? 

Thanks!
